October 10, 2014
Community Feedback
Data & analysis from the feedback

general feedback

Generally the feedback is very positive, with most users splitting their time:

  • finding solutions to their problems (23.58%)
  • browsing the forums (20%)
  • gain insights (17%)
  • helping others (17%)

Popular write-in options were:

  • Check firmware
  • Check for beta updates

Almost half of those surveyed use the forum more than once a day, with two-thirds of surveyed users using ths site more than 10 times a month. More than 80% of users would highly recommend the Community to their colleagues.

The aggregate feedback analysis can be found on Google Drive

feature requests

The most important feature requests are compiled as follows:

Easily Found Information

Users are having problems finding information. Either they have to be very good at using the search engine, or relevant information is deeply buried and is difficult to find, either through searching or browsing.

A centralized information area prevents questions from being asked over and over again, and improves navigation and content discovery. Product Knowledge Base.

Centralized Content

Official, curated product information. Provides:

  1. introductory information
  2. getting-started
  3. technical sheet
  4. tutorials, videos
  5. startup and basic set-up a system and running (esp. UniFi)
  6. firewall compatibility
  7. product info
  8. compliance information
  9. startup script examples
  10. configuration script examples
  11. links to relevant forum areas
  12. technical sheet
  13. facts
  14. links to Q&A, solutions, and Issues & Bugs
  15. firmware status & downloads
  16. manuals
  17. latest up-to-date info
  18. warranty
  19. end-of-life product status / legacy products
  20. status tracking: What’s changed over time, and what’s improved. Current status, and fixed problems.
  21. beta and update status?

The Knowledge Base would help people save time on searching for answers or from asking “basic” questions. This is the place to start, and for users to find the easy, popular solutions. Contains newest updates. Needs to be filterable, searchable, organized by task and product.

Product Firmware Status

Transparency on firmware: Status page for firmwares for all devices that give checklist for completed parts of development towards release of the firmware, as well as estimated completion times for firmware as a whole, and individual objectives inside of the development of the firmware to give people better understanding of current status so they can plan around.

Centralized Product Updates

Similar to the Centralized Content idea, this is a centralized place to display and notify of new or updated content. This is a notification system or blog that people can follow. This is an easily memorable place for users to know something at Ubiquiti has changed. It’s the changelog for products, and should also cover beta, and should cover updates concerning product cycles, product releases, and official announcements.

Known Issues

Bug reporting and log system, maybe as part of feature req. Upvoting system.
Hardware issues, fault-finding (hardware bugs?). Update official “known issues” and updates more frequently (3)

Idea exchange

Modify the stories area to iprove idea exchanging by adding things like tags. Make them easier to discover for people in similar situations, to see if something worked or did not work. These will become sorts of examples forthe knowledge base. research to see if something has been tried by others (Jan: in stories, ID what equipment used w/ tags, and environment / factors)

Localization

Keep the same forum framework for other languages. Pull in English content if localized content is sparse

Forum update tracking

Subscriptions and recent threads and posts. See newest responses of a thread / continue where you left off. See what threads have been updated since you were here. Even better if filtered by subforum or section. Live load. Subscriptions. Work properly, not insanely slow. should show the new posts first, not old posts (3)

Forum management

Mitigate some of the disparaging comments and trolls (ars technica-like downvoting / hiding? maybe don’t show downvotes, but enough downvotes hides it automatically and flags for trolling). Users with a lot of solutions and or kudos should have a Guru-status

Email direct replies

Need a Email direct reply to forum thread

Lounge & Business talk area

A place to hang out and get to know each other; somewhere less official and not product-related. Connecting w/ other WISPS. More places to share stories and talk about tangential topics.

Flagging Unanswered Posts & Questions

Some questions go unanswered for a long time. Might need a staff to answer these, become buried. (Jan: flagging system?) +1
